sources.title: Ashes of Vengeance
sources.description: Title: Ashes of Vengeance Summary: When Empress Catherine of France launches an attack on French Protestants known as Huguenots, the Comte de la Roche saves the life of his enemy, the Huguenot Rupert de Vrieac, by making him... Directed by: Frank Lloyd Actors: Norma Talmadge, Conway Tearle, Wallace Beery Production Company: Norma Talmadge Film Corporation Release Date: 6 August 1923 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.33 : 1 Color: Black and White When Empress Catherine of France launches an attack on French Protestants known as Huguenots, the Comte de la Roche saves the life of his enemy, the Huguenot Rupert de Vrieac, by making him an indentured servant in his castle. Rupert falls in love with Yolande, the count's sister, and finds that his rival for the fair Yolande's hand is none other than the despicable Duc de Tours, a notorious torturer of Huguenots.

sources.title: "Ashes of Vengeance" (1923) director Frank Lloyd with Norma Talmadge
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "Ashes of Vengeance" is a historical drama. The events in the film occur in 16th century France. The film was created by the Oscar-winning director Frank Lloyd.   Directed by                Frank Lloyd Produced by              Norma Talmadge Film Corporation Scenario                      Frank Lloyd Based on                    the novel Ashes of Vengeance by H.B. Somerville Starring                     Norma Talmadge, Conway Tearle, Wallace Beery, Courtenay Foote Cinematography        Tony Gaudio Distributed by           Associated First National Pictures Release date               August 6, 1923 Running time             102 min. Country                      United States Language                    Silent film, English intertitles   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: When Empress Catherine of France launches an attack on French Protestants known as Huguenots, the Comte de la Roche saves the life of his enemy, the Huguenot Rupert de Vrieac, by making him an indentured servant in his castle. Rupert falls in love with Yolande, the count's sister, and finds that his rival for the fair Yolande's hand is none other than the despicable Duc de Tours, a notorious torturer of Huguenots.
